question.title: Make generated class implement my custom interface in Java
question.body:
I have two classes generated from OpenAPI that I cannot modify:

public class Foo {
    public String getA() {
        // ...
    }

    public String getB() {
        // ...
    }
}

and:

public class Bar {
    public String getA() {
        // ...
    }

    public String getB() {
        // ...
    }
}

I want to write a utility method that will work for both classes. Normally, I would use an interface and make both classes implement it:

public interface FooBarable{
    String getA();
    String getB();
}

and then write my utility method:

public static String calculate(FooBarable foo) {
// ..
}

I don't want to make two implementations for each of the classes. I wonder if there is a way to make those classes implement an interface, even though I can't modify them.
